cluster_relations.rel_desc: Conservation efforts aim to protect biodiversity.

qualifiers.UncertaintyQualifier: help guide (indirect protection via informed efforts)

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Conservation efforts work to protect ecosystem functioning.
remarks: Ecosystem function mapped to broader concept of ecosystem functioning.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an action or set of actions has the explicit goal of protecting or safeguarding the target entity or process, even if the protection is indirect or mediated.
args.justification: Both relations describe conservation efforts whose explicit goal is to protect some aspect of the ecosystem (biodiversity, ecosystem functioning). The direction (efforts → protected aspect) and the semantics (goal-oriented protection, possibly indirect) are identical, so a single canonical predicate 'aims_to_protect' is appropriate.
args.remark: Protection is described as a goal of conservation actions, not guaranteed or fully realized; the canonical predicate focuses on intent/aim rather than outcome.

args.justification: In both instances the predicate links conservation actions to their intended protective goals (what they seek to safeguard). This is a specific family of relations: goals or objectives of conservation activities, so 'conservation_goal_relation' is an appropriate class.

The rel_hint_type is 'goal', and the descriptions explicitly use goal-oriented phrasing ('aim to protect', 'work to protect'). This places the relation in a broad intentional/goal-oriented semantic group rather than pure causality or composition.
